title: Account Manager Mascus
excerpt: Ritchie Bros | Everything you need to succeedWhen you join Ritchie Bros, you’ll be part of a diverse, global team that is aiming to achieve the largest growth in our company’s history.
description:
Ritchie Bros | Everything you need to succeed

When you join Ritchie Bros, you’ll be part of a diverse, global team that is aiming to achieve the largest growth in our company’s history. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit and are passionate about delivering great customer experiences, we invite you to join our growing team.

To maintain our position as a leading digital platform for selling used equipment, we are looking for an Account Manager to join our team in the UK.

In this role you are always on the move. Traveling your working area and working from your (home)office, you build relationships with (new) customers as the preferred partner when- and wherever they want to sell used equipment. You will be responsible for the South West & South East part of the UK. You sell our listing service (formally known as Mascus) which gives your client the opportunity to be fully in control of the sales process.

Your activities are close to those of your colleagues of our Marketplace-E team. The main difference: you are bringing a solution to your client which has the highest investment to pay-out ratio. Your business moves fast and so do you. Your main goal is to generate a continuous flow of new equipment listings. Making outbound calls through-out the day in high volumes is how you make sure the sales process never stops. We provide you with all the training and tools you need, including company car, to be successful running your own shop.

You will be accountable for:

  • Process high volume outbound calls per day
  • Generate new and repeat sales by providing excellent customer service
  • Meet sales goals for the month/year and increase sales by cross-selling
  • Cultivate your sales funnel
  • Effectively maintain sales and customer database
  • Coordinate with other departments to ensure customer satisfaction

Here is what you bring:

You don’t mind focusing on volume during your sales process. You know that high input plus discipline equals a constant and high pay-out. Nevertheless, our business requires more than closing a single deal. Strong relationship building skills are essential in this role. It would be great if you had a connection to heavy machinery as this makes it easier to understand your client’s business, but it is not a requirement. You do have:

  • At least 4 years of experience in account management or inside sales
  • Professional level English
  • Experience leveraging CRM-tools

What We Offer

When you join Ritchie Bros. we want you to be on board for a long time. From the start we’ll give you an indefinite employment agreement and plenty of professional and career development opportunities combined with fair pay. Across Europe we have 45 colleagues in our Mascus team. Once an independent company, our Mascus team still has an above average feeling of teamwork and comradery. The team has an average length of employment of almost 6 years even though we have had a lot of new joiners. If you love working in a diverse sales team, this is where you need to be!

Who are we?

Ritchie Bros. is a global asset management and disposition company. We help our customers buy and sell a wide range of used and unused equipment for construction, mining, transportation, agriculture, oil & gas, lifting & material handling, forestry & other industries.

title: Procurement Director
excerpt: We are seeking a Procurement Director to build and lead a modern, strategic procurement function that supports Acumatica’s scale, growth, and operational maturity.
description:
We are seeking a Procurement Director to build and lead a modern, strategic procurement function that supports Acumatica’s scale, growth, and operational maturity.

This is not a transactional purchasing role. It is a leadership role focused on creating leverage for the business through disciplined sourcing, strong commercial judgment, and clear accountability for spend. The Procurement Director will help shape how the company makes investment decisions and partners across functions.

Reporting to the CFO, this role owns enterprise-wide procurement strategy across software, cloud infrastructure, professional services, marketing, and corporate spend. They will work closely with Finance, IT, Product, Engineering, Security, Legal, Marketing and People teams to ensure we are investing intentionally, negotiating effectively, and operating with transparency.

This is a builder role for someone who is comfortable operating at altitude, moving between strategy and execution, creating structure where little exists today, and bringing a clear point of view on how procurement should enable better decisions rather than slow them down.

This is a role for someone who isn’t afraid to build, move between detail and strategy with ease, and serve as a true thought partner to senior leadership. The right person will raise the bar for how we operate and help shape the next chapter of Acumatica’s growth.

This role reports to the CFO and we're open to hire remotely in the US.

Responsabilities:

  • Build and own Acumatica’s end-to-end procurement function, including strategy, policies, operating cadence, and decision frameworks.
  • Establish clear, scalable processes that provide visibility into vendor spend, contract terms, renewals, and ownership, while balancing speed, control, and accountability.
  • Lead strategic sourcing and end-to-end commercial negotiations across SaaS, cloud infrastructure, IT services, and other critical vendors, including pricing, contract structure, terms, SLAs, and exit provisions.
  • Rationalize and actively manage the vendor portfolio by reducing tool sprawl, strengthening senior-level vendor relationships, and holding partners accountable for performance and delivered value.
  • Partner with Finance to ensure procurement decisions are tightly connected to budgets, forecasts, and long-range plans, with clear visibility into financial impact.
  • Drive value creation through disciplined cost optimization and rigorous business cases for major investments and renewals, including clear alternatives and tradeoffs.
  • Partner closely with IT, Security, Product, Engineering, and Legal to ensure vendor decisions meet technical, security, and compliance requirements.
  • Act as a thought partner to functional leaders by surfacing total cost of ownership, second-order impacts, and the right questions before spend is committed.
  • Ensure appropriate diligence for new vendors, including financial stability, security posture, contractual risk, and regulatory considerations.
  • Establish clear governance and ownership for vendor relationships and contracts post-signature, maintaining ongoing compliance with data privacy and security requirements
  • Establish a culture of ownership, responsiveness, and practical problem-solving.
  • 10+ years of experience in procurement, sourcing, or vendor management, with significant exposure to SaaS, cloud infrastructure, or technology-driven organizations.
  • Proven experience negotiating complex software and services agreements with large and mid-sized vendors.
  • Strong understanding of SaaS economics, cloud pricing models, licensing structures, and renewal dynamics.
  • Track record of building procurement processes or functions in growing operationally complex environments.
  • Ability to balance commercial rigor with strong cross-functional relationships.
  • Comfort operating with ambiguity and creating structure where none exists.
  • Strong judgment, executive communication skills, and a bias toward action.
  • Bachelor’s degree required; MBA or relevant advanced degree preferred.

Acumatica is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
If you have a disability and you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to submit an online application, please e-mail HR@acumatica.com. This email is created exclusively to assist disabled job seekers whose disability prevents them from being able to apply online. Only emails sent for this purpose will be returned. Emails sent for other purposes, such as following up on an application or technical issues not related to a disability, will not receive a response.

For this role, the salary range is $175,000-$200,000 annually. This range represents the low and high end of the salary range for this job and may vary based on location. The actual salary offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including skills, qualifications, experience and other relevant elements.
At Acumatica, certain roles are eligible for additional rewards, including annual bonus and stock. These awards are allocated based on individual performance. In addition, certain roles also have the opportunity to earn sales incentives based on revenue or utilization, depending on the terms of the plan and the employee’s role.

Benefits/perks listed here may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Acumatica and the country where you work. US-based employees gain access to healthcare benefits (medical, dental and vision insurance for you and your dependents), employer paid Short-Term/Long-Term Disability and Basic life coverage, 401(k) plan with company match, Flexible time off, sick and safe leave, among others.

Acumatica is a company on a mission. We are a leading innovator in cloud ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) solutions with growing businesses worldwide. But don’t take our word for it—read what analysts like G2, IDC, Nucleus Research, and Info-Tech have to say about us. Acumatica is different by design and purposely built to help small and midsized companies thrive in today’s digital economy. Our industry-specific business management solution is engineered to address real-world needs—featuring intelligent workflows and market-leading usability that enable companies to manage risk, anticipate disruption, and seize new opportunities. Our principled business practices, growth-friendly licensing, and flexible deployment options put organizations in control of their own future. Acumatica is more than just a product—we are a community of partners, customers, and creators committed to elevating business performance. Our ecosystem is driven by collaboration, merging leading technology and real-world insights to put organizations control of their future. In May of 2025, Acumatica was acquired by Vista Equity Partners, a global investment firm focused on enterprise software, data and technology-enabled businesses.

Acumatica’s culture is collaborative and high-energy. We are passionate about our product and our mission, and we are loyal to each other and our company. We value work/life balance, efficiency, simplicity, freakishly friendly customer service, and making a difference in the world. Acumatica offers exceptional professional and financial growth potential. To learn more about Acumatica’s mission, please visit: http://www.acumatica.com.

About Adobe

Adobe empowers everyone to create through innovative platforms and tools that unleash creativity, productivity and personalized customer experiences. Adobe’s industry-leading offerings including Adobe Acrobat Studio, Adobe Express, Adobe Firefly, Creative Cloud, Adobe Experience Platform, Adobe Experience Manager, and GenStudio enable people and businesses to turn ideas into impact, powered by AI and driven by human ingenuity.

Our 30,000+ employees worldwide are creating the future and raising the bar as we drive the next decade of growth. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and believe in creating a company culture where all employees are empowered to make an impact. At Adobe, we believe that great ideas can come from anywhere in the organization. The next big idea could be yours.


Let’s Adobe together

At Adobe, we believe in creating a company culture where all employees are empowered to make an impact. Learn more about Adobe life, including our values and culture, focus on people, purpose and community, Adobe for All, comprehensive benefits programs, the stories we tell, the customers we serve, and how you can help us advance our mission of empowering everyone to create.

Adobe is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic. Learn more.

Adobe aims to make our Careers website and recruiting process accessible to any and all users. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to navigate our website or complete the application process, email accommodations@adobe.com or call +1 408-536-3015.

AI Use Guidelines for Interviews:
Our interviews are designed to reflect your own skills and thinking. The use of AI or recording tools during live interviews is not permitted unless explicitly invited by the interviewer or approved in advance as part of a reasonable accommodation. If these tools are used inappropriately or in a way that misrepresents your work, your application may not move forward in the process.

At Adobe, we empower employees to innovate with AI — and we look for candidates eager to do the same. As part of the hiring experience, we provide clear guidance on where AI is encouraged during the process and where it’s restricted during live interviews. See how we think about AI in the hiring experience.

Expected Pay Range:

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several  U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $178,200 -- $289,000 annually. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process.In New York, the pay range for this position is $199,600 - $289,000

At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).

In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

State-Specific Notices:

California:

Fair Chance Ordinances

Adobe will consider qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records for employment in accordance with state and local laws and “fair chance” ordinances.

Application Window Notice

If this role is open to hiring in Colorado (as listed on the job posting), the application window will remain open until at least the date and time stated above in Pacific Time, in compliance with Colorado pay transparency regulations. If this role does not have Colorado listed as a hiring location, no specific application window applies, and the posting may close at any time based on hiring needs.

Massachusetts Legal Notice

It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.
